meanings.definition: To have a feeling of aversion or antipathy towards something or someone.
meanings.sent1: She disliked the taste of broccoli.
meanings.sent2: He always disliked going to the dentist.
meanings.sent3: The cat disliked getting wet in the rain.
meanings.sent4: The student disliked the idea of taking a pop quiz.
meanings.sent5: The little girl disliked the loud noise of thunderstorms.

meanings.sent1: The disliked movie received poor reviews.
meanings.sent2: The old, disliked sweater was finally thrown away.
meanings.sent3: The disliked painting was hidden in the attic.
meanings.sent4: The disliked food was left untouched on the plate.
meanings.sent5: The disliked classmate was avoided by many students.
